## R Markdown

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

combi_tri <-  read.csv(file = "/Users/mutecypher/Documents/Documents - Michael’s iMac/Coursera/Capstone Project/processed/combi_trigrams.csv", colClasses = c("NULL", NA, NA, NA) )
combi_tri <- data.table(combi_tri)
print(prettyNum(object.size(combi_tri), big.mark = ",", scientific = FALSE))
combi_tri <- setorder(setDT(combi_tri), bigrams, -n) [,indx :=seq_len(.N), by = bigrams] [indx <= 5 & n > 1]
setkey(combi_tri, bigrams)
print(prettyNum(object.size(combi_tri), big.mark = ",", scientific = FALSE))
write.csv(combi_tri, file = "/Users/mutecypher/Documents/Documents - Michael’s iMac/Coursera/Capstone Project/processed/shrink_tri.csv")
